alert.note: Alert for Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; Southwest Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 7:31PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Elko County through 800 PM PDT... At 730 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northwest of Ruby Valley, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rainfall along with gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Elko County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; Southwest Elko County
